Freedom, liberty, especially: a state of freedom from slavery. From eleutheros; freedom.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

1.str2: To free, set free, liberate. From eleutheros; to liberate, i.e. to exempt.

1.str2: To stand fast, stand firm, persevere. From the perfect tense of histemi; to be stationary, i.e. to persevere.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

1.str2: From en and echo; to hold in or upon, i.e. Ensnare; by implication, to keep a grudge.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.
From the root of zeugnumi; a coupling, i.e. servitude; also the beam of the balance.

Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

2.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

From agathos; goodness, i.e. Virtue or beneficence.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

23.str2: Mildness, gentleness. From praus; mildness, i.e. humility.
Self-mastery, self-restraint, self-control, continence. From egkrates; self-control.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
(including the other inflections); from toi and houtos; truly this, i.e. Of this sort (to denote character or individuality).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

23.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

24.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

24.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
24.str2: From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a presumed derivative of pathos; something undergone, i.e. Hardship or pain; subjectively, an emotion or influence.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.

25.str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

25.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
25.str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.

25.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
25.str2: To walk in, walk by. From a derivative of steicho; to march in rank, i.e. to conform to virtue and piety.

26.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
26.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Vainglorious, boastful. From kenos and doxa; vainly glorifying, i.e. Self-conceited.

26.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
26.str2: To provoke, stimulate, challenge, call out. Middle voice from pro and kaleo; to call forth to oneself, i.e. to irritate.

26.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
26.str2: To envy. From phthonos; to be jealous of.

26.parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
26.str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
